result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.

01:21 PM  All appeared through Zoom platform. Defendant Daniel J. Drozda in court.  Attorney Rachel E. Pisors in court for Daniel J. Drozda.  Attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney PIsors has requested to withdraw as counsel. Defendants comments. Court grants request for the withdraw.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Motion and order to withdraw as attorney

2:22 PM Defendant Daniel J. Drozda appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Rachel E. Pisors appeared in court for Daniel J. Drozda.  Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his in person appearance and has no objection to appearing remotely. Defendant acknowledges receipt of the Information. Waived reading of Information. The Defendant Entered a plea of not guilty. Defense requested a bond modification. State objects to modification. Court denies request for bond modification. Existing bond remains in effect.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Rachel Pisors
to modify bond conditions

The defendant shall have no contact with Kayla N Szydel of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way. Exception with a third party to make arrangements to retrieve personal property    Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.

1:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Ellen Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel J. Drozda appeared by video, in custody from Clark County Jail.  Did not receive criminal complaint.   Defendant advised of right to an attorney.
